I only know the outcome, not what causes it.
I oversimplify theories so much that they lose their meaning.
I struggle to explain abstract concepts in a useful way.
I repeat the same explanation whether it makes sense or not.
My analogies misrepresent the principle and confuse people.
I accept arguments without questioning assumptions.
I miss logical fallacies in arguments.
I accept conclusions without checking the reasoning.
I never test my reasoning against counterexamples.
I miss contradictions and let them stand.
I rely on vague words because I don’t know the terms.
I describe ideas loosely without proper notation.
I use key terms without defining them.
I confuse similar technical concepts with each other.
I avoid specialized vocabulary because I don’t know it.
I accept statistics at face value.
I cite sources without checking their credibility.
I summarize studies without questioning their methods.
I ignore gaps in evidence when reviewing claims.
I focus on a single study without comparison.
I stick to one framework because I don’t know others.
I choose a model without weighing alternatives.
I use whichever theory I know without reflection.
I describe an approach without mentioning its limits.
I pick methods at random without justification.
I accept arguments regardless of their logic.
I overlook misrepresentations in data.
I edit text without noticing accuracy problems.
I miss inconsistencies in documents.
I treat opinions as if they were facts.
I treat this idea in isolation without context.
I struggle to connect theory with practice.
I see new information as unrelated to anything else.
I describe concepts without context.
I describe specific cases without linking them to theory.
I state conclusions without reasoning.
I assume an approach works in all cases.
I miss nuances and only see the basics.
I miss contradictions when reviewing data.
I explain concepts in a disorganized way.
I skip controls and assume results are valid.
I simplify so much that key ideas are lost.
I know that methods work but not why.
I describe methodologies but can’t evaluate them.
I look at results without considering theory.
I assume the first explanation I hear is correct.
I struggle to describe statistical models at all.
I accept claims without testing them.
I skip steps when following logic.
I overlook mismatches between evidence and conclusion.
I make claims without evidence.
I give the same explanation regardless of the audience.
I let gaps in reasoning pass unnoticed.
I apply theories incorrectly to new contexts.
I miss errors unless they are obvious.
I summarize literature without critique.
I accept calculations without verification.
I list frameworks without explanation.
I repeat ambiguous statements without clarification.
I overlook key variables in experiments.
I ignore metrics when evaluating models.
I pick theories without structured comparison.
I misuse or confuse difficult terms.
I accept assumptions without question.
I jump between points without logic.
I assume evidence is enough without checking.
I present results without context.
I accept overreaching claims.
I ignore bias in sources.
I don’t test hypotheses against alternatives.
I approach problems haphazardly.
I treat all evidence as the same.
I rely on a single piece of evidence for arguments.
I accept findings without questioning them.
I overlook accuracy in presentations.
I describe models without mentioning theory.
I don’t notice contradictions in published work.
I present conclusions that overstate the data.
I teach concepts in a confusing order.
I accept weak analogies as accurate.
I explain processes without causal links.
I structure papers haphazardly.
I miss inconsistencies in arguments.
I rely on one discipline only.
I accept claims without counterarguments.
I overlook misuse of terms.
I confuse people with unclear math reasoning.
I ignore inaccuracies in diagrams.
I miss flaws in survey design.
I recite laws or rules without examples.
I assume results apply universally without testing.
I don’t notice cherry-picking of evidence.
I don’t check writing for logical consistency.
I forget to connect results back to the hypothesis.
I use definitions inconsistently.
I accept claims without evaluation.
I ignore alternative interpretations of data.
